remotejskim326 wrote:
>
> Hi.
>
> I'm struggling to make a MYSQL writer processor in Heritrix.
>
> My question is
>
> 1. How can I see the source code of existing writer processor such as
> ARCWriterProcessor. I tried to open the source code in NETBEANS with
> heritrix-1.12.1.jar, but I couldn't find any source code in that file.
>










The src is not built into the jar.  You need to check out the source 
code.  The manual is a little out of date but gives you the general 
gist: 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual/building.html#N10036.  
Run 'svn checkout 
https://archive-crawler.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/archive-crawler/trunk/heritrix' 
(or use the URL 
'https://archive-crawler.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/archive-crawler/branches/heritrix_1_12' 
if you want to get the src of the current release).


>
> 2. I wonder how I can put my import my class to heritrix. Do I need to
> make additional jar file, and save it to library file and declare my
> class in Processor.options? Processor.options is read-only and I can't
> modify it.
>






Study the 'Hadoop DFS Writer Processor 
<http://www.zvents.com/labs/heritrix_hadoop>'.  Its linked off the 
heritrix home page.  Its a complete writer developed external to the 
crawler that can be integrated just by dropping a few jars into the 
heritrix lib directory.   It has its own ant build.xml and good 
documentation on how to build.

You can also check out the other writers that are integral to heritrix.

St.Ack


>
> It's confusing and would somebody explain it how it works for beginners?
>
> I've read development documents but it didn't help me much.
>
> Thank you.
>
>
